title: Christian Pulisic warned he has a ‘major problem’ at Chelsea despite Frank Lampard encouragement
text:
Christian Pulisic has endured a slow start to his career at Chelsea (Picture: Getty)

Christian Pulisic would not have been signed by Chelsea had Frank Lampard been manger at the time, according to Chris Sutton, who says the USA international faces a ‘major problem’ at Stamford Bridge.

Chelsea agreed a £58million deal with Borussia Dortmund for Pulisic last January, with the American completing his move to west London in the summer.

After a bright start to life in the Premier League, Pulisic has frequently been sidelined by Lampard in recent weeks and was left out of the Blues’ squad altogether for the Champions League clash at Lille.

Sutton says Pulisic can still revive his Chelsea career and prove his worth to Lampard but insists the 21-year-old faces an uphill battle to cement a place in the starting XI at the Bridge.

Frank Lampard appears to have reservations with the American (Picture: Getty)

‘Pulisic has to prove himself,’ Sutton told Radio 5 Live. ‘Frank Lampard has no agenda against him, he’s picking the best possible team to win games of football, that’s his job.

Advertisement

Advertisement

‘He wasn’t Frank’s signing, of course.

‘With Callum Hudson-Odoi and Mason Mount coming to the fore, he’s going to have a major problem getting into the starting line-up. I really do think that.

‘I don’t see a way in for him at the moment. It’s a lot of money to spend and it would be interesting to ask Frank now if he would sign him at this moment in time if he hadn’t signed him before?

‘The answer to that, I think, is pretty obvious – he wouldn’t.

‘But, there’s a reason Chelsea spent the money on him, he’s still a young man and got enormous talent, he has to go out and show it.

‘It’s good for Frank in terms of strength in depth.’

Pulisic admits he was ‘hurt’ to be snubbed by Lampard earlier in the season but says he will ‘keep working harder’ in order to win the Chelsea manager around.

Chris Sutton says Pulisic faces a ‘major problem’ at Chelsea (Picture: Getty)

‘That’s my job,’ Pulisic said after providing an assist in Chelsea’s 4-1 victory over Southampton on Sunday.

Advertisement

Advertisement

‘I’m in an attacking role and I’m going to do the best I can, to try to get goals and assists. I think that’s been good so far, so I just want to continue to work hard.

‘I want to be starting. I want to be starting every game. I’m working hard in training. I want to be there. I hope everyone can see that, I hope I can make a case for myself.

‘I’m not just going to throw a fit and give up ever, so if I’m on the bench it doesn’t mean the gaffer doesn’t think I’m a part of the team, I’ve just got to keep pushing and earn my spot.

‘I did the best I could with the minutes I got. I tried to help the team. I guess I’m happy but I’m going to keep working harder, and I’m never going to stop trying to get more minutes.’

Lampard, meanwhile, assured Pulisic that he would be an important member of Chelsea’s team after the emphatic victory over Southampton.

The Blues boss said: ‘Christian coming on with a great assist for the goal. Those players, absolutely we need them as the games come thick and fast.

‘At the moment we are going well and keeping a similar core of the team.

Advertisement

‘But we are going to need everyone and that means training at a level and being happy as a complete group when we come away and get a result like this.’
